lexUnit.name: repeated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: occurring more than once; again and again.

sentence.text: Repeated attempts to provoke an attack may cause the symptoms to disappear altogether .
Repeated unsuccessful attempts to cut down , and not feeling drunk even after a large quantity of alcohol , are other warning signs .

Ignore the fact that a nut may be weakened by repeated use as hammer .
In response to repeated pleas not to use life-sustaining and life-prolonging technology inappropriately to extend the process of dying , doctors are learning to say no .

This book will stand repeated and careful reading .
Extrinsic ageing stems from repeated or persistent injury to the body tissues leading to a kind of degeneration that makes us older than our years .
